definition: in the course of doing one's work/on business

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to die as in the line of duty (idiom)

sentences.english: The chairman is in Holland on business.
sentences.chinese: 董事长因公在荷兰访问。

sentences.english: Whether our lovable party did die in line of duty this professor locates the martyr?
sentences.chinese: 我们可爱的党是否把这位因公殉职的教授定位烈士呢？

sentences.english: He died on the job while repairing a streetlamp.
sentences.chinese: 他在修路灯时因公殉职。

sentences.english: Those wounded or disabled on the job are provided living expenses from the state or the collective.
sentences.chinese: 对于因公致伤致残的，其生活费用由国家和集体承担。

sentences.english: The new insurance rules speculate that the disabled FOR the public benefit are to receive more money.
sentences.chinese: 新的保险条例规定因公伤残者将得到更多的抚恤金。

sentences.english: Business trips never leave much time for sightseeing.
sentences.chinese: 因公出差从来没有很多时间去观光。

sentences.english: More than 800 officers were killed in the line of duty last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年一年有超过800名警察因公殉职。

sentences.english: I remember the day his partner, his best friend was gone down in the line of duty.
sentences.chinese: 他的同伴，同样也是他最好的朋友因公殉职。

definition: private (i.e. not work-related 因公[yin1 gong1])
to die as in the line of duty (idiom)
to be reimbursed for actual expenses
to hasten home for the funeral of a parent or grandparent
official leave from work (e.g. maternity leave, sick leave or leave to attend to official business)
leave of absence for a personal matter
to visit/to call on sb/to look around
